What Nedzu and Gremlin do to his computer when the auxiliary power generator kicks in is something he doesn‚Äôt find out about until he wakes up in a jail cell. 

 

***

Nedzu goes on a rampage after he and Gremlin manage to open up the entire computer system in front of them. He shifts through tens of thousands of pages of text within minutes, his High Spec quirk powered up fully. He finds names. Locations. Bank accounts. He speaks through the phone to the president of the Hero Commission and for the first time in the history of their work relationship, she says nothing back. She listens. And issues orders to her staff. 

The Warp-Railway through Korea is severed by the local police and heroes who storm the buildings (mostly half-ruined warehouses) secretly owned by Detnerat shell companies. Everywhere throughout Japan the hidden MLA members are ousted and arrested by the heroes, police and the Paragons - the list including every single spy that the PLF had. Bank accounts through which the money flows from outside supporters to the PLF are frozen. Foreign governments and corporations that decided to (for a variety of reasons) support the villain group discover their support to no longer be a well-guarded secret.  

Nedzu and the HPSC dismantle the entire support framework of the PLF - the entire secret empire of information, cash flow and material support allowing it to engage a much bigger country in an open war. They do that within two hours. 

Dreamer ads more when she wakes up. Such as a final confirmation that the Overhaul that they are facing is the final copy. The uncontrolled burst of his quirk after awakening levelled his primary lab down. It was going to take months to finish the next version of his body (the discovery that they were facing a monster with less than 25% of what it could have startles everyone).

PLF won‚Äôt have that time - All Might destroys the lab where the next body is worked on before being warped back to UA by Kurogiri. The Overhaul‚Äôs perfect body is destroyed in its incomplete state and without a quirk transfer happening. With the lab destroyed thoroughly, it will take Overhaul no less than six months to restore what was lost. 

They also understand the Overhaul‚Äôs long term plan. Take over Japan to be allowed to look for Eri (the only hope for an actual mass-scale permanent anti-quirk weapon rather than complicated surgical and biochemical procedures that created the Purified) without interference and with the government‚Äôs strength behind him. Izuku doesn‚Äôt comment on that, but Overhaul is probably booking on All for One‚Äôs unwillingness to just move out if that happens. 230+ of life, and yet he left Japan only a few times (and never for longer than two months). Besides, All for One RUNNING AWAY? 

Four more laboratories on Hokkaido are destroyed or damaged by missile strikes of the Maritime Self-Defense Force ships, severely delaying Overhaul‚Äôs ability to clone quirks and limiting PLF‚Äôs capability to produce the new Purified. 

It isn‚Äôt all that happens, though. When the attention of Japan is focused on all those operations, League of Villains cheerfully ignores international borders and uses Sunset to launch an unexpected raid on the international base that Overhaul used before annexing the Meta-Liberation Army and moving over to Hokkaido. It is mostly abandoned at this point. There are some noumus stationed there and a handful of bored QLF soldiers. But there is also something more. Something that even Overhaul forgot about. 

The base is thoroughly destroyed before the League returns back to Japan with their spoils.

Chapter 60: Paranormal Liberation War [IV]

    The war ends.

Chapter Text

***

Day One Hundred Seven

The forces Overhaul brought to attack the UA were massive. Musutafu was evacuated (in a hurry), and its streets were filled with PLF troops. Two hundred Purified, a crowd of remaining noumus (including the sole still standing High End), dozens of Geten and Re-Destro clones, thousands of regular warriors and no less than a hundred A-Ranker escapees. 

Plus, of course, Re-Destro and Overhaul themselves. This time there was no pulling back punches. 

In front of them lies the UA. Currently - after Nedzu‚Äôs maniacal monetary spending ever since the start of the war - the best defended place in Japan. UA Wall was expanded into a towering, several level monstrosity armed to the teeth with automatic guns, anti-tank cannons and even missile launchers.

The entire security had several back-ups, including no less than three separate drone networks capable of taking over the whole thing, with the defences continuing to work even if the PLF amassed all their technopaths in their army for a single attack. This was going to be no Tartarus. 

The enemies that would fight their way through the UA Wall would have found themselves facing the second line of defenses - a network of bunkers and pillboxes (established by late Cementoss before his departure for the frontlines) garrisoned by the GSDF forces with support of the pro-heroes, vigilante and villains (of the League) that Nedzu managed to gather before Overhaul reached his school. 

Plus, of course, robots. Lots of robots. Including thirty Executors, known to the school students as the 0-Pointers. This time with all limiters off, like they were during the Training Camp attack. Lethal attacks, no automatic shutdowns after being hit anywhere with sufficient strength. It was a war, after all. 

If both defense lines were going to fall, the defenders were going to fall back to the actual school grounds, where they would hold the ground until the plan B (the joint - and rather desperate - creation of Legion and Sir Nighteye) could be executed.

The battle started with the remaining QLF units shelling the school grounds from a distance. The counter-battery fire silenced them within three minutes, with Nedzu and Power Loader directing the artillery units of GSDF, QEM and UA to open fire upon the advancing army. 

 

***

The biggest miscalculation of the Paranormal Liberation Front during the Battle for UA were the automatic defenses of the UA Wall. There was a reason why guns were optional in the modern world of crimes. Stronger quirk users could either tank, dodge or kill from a distance every gun user. The UA Wall carried some really nasty guns, but the PLF had Purified. So no biggy, right?

Wrong. 

PLF now non-existent spies failed to notice that one of the companies participating in the UA Wall expansion project was in fact a shell company of the Villain Industries. Nedzu refused to take any chances with the defenses of his beloved school. He had David Shield inspect every single one of Gremlin‚Äôs additions to the Wall, in order to make sure that the League sneaked in no surprises. And even then, he was still going to tear it down after the war ended. 

The combination of the engineering genius of David Shield and the engineering madness of Gremlin (with some organizational and planning help from Power Loader) created one of the most terrifying things in history. Especially as Nedzu greenlighted the addition of some choice Detnerat Specials to the mix. 

The result of that was a massacre. Horrifying, trauma-inducing massacre that almost turned the Paranormal Liberation Front attack into a total rout. Scenes in front of the UA Wall wouldn‚Äôt be surprising on the fields of Flanders during the First World War, but in the modern times they were shocking.

Without the Purified, the assault on the UA would end before it started. The gigantified Purified marched as a vanguard, shrugging off even the heaviest of blows with their additional resistance-increasing and regeneration quirks. That was part of Nedzu's plan, however - they might have approached the UA Wall, but Captain Celebrity and All Might were there, jumping or flying between wall sections, wiping them out one by one while the Overhaul and his command staff could only throw curses at them. 

Two more died as Gremlin fired her slightly oversized railgun from the rooftop of the UA main building. The energy consumption was terrifying, but making the heads of living, kaiju-sized tanks vanish in a cloud of red was certainly one way of establishing a superiority on the battlefield. 

Overhaul‚Äôs strongest blade was blunted. Eventually the smaller Purified tore through the turrets on the UA Wall and Re-Destro himself caved in the main UA gate with his fists, but the price for that was enormous. During the first thirty minutes of the assault, PLF lost no less than thirty thousand soldiers (wounded, traumatized, dead - or worse) and fifty Purified. 

Overhaul shouted in anger and ordered his Eclipse clones to move outside of the range of the UA coordinate scramblers to start warping in reinforcements. The battle was going to be much more bloody than he anticipated. 

Oh if only he knew. 

 

***

The PLF forces poured onto the UA grounds only to discover several nasty things. The first one that they discovered almost instantly was the fact that the mines used during the last school festival weren‚Äôt the only type of landmines available to the UA. There were others, and while not lethal or even damaging to the Purified, they slowed down the advance of the former MLA warriors. 

The second thing they discovered was that Nedzu was a mad genius. He was the one who planned the entire second defensive layer (the first one was more of a welcome party to him, this one was the real deal). And he did that by taking full advantage of his High Spec quirk. 

The pillboxes, bunkers and so on were placed perfectly. With mechanical precision and attention to details that made any deviations from the original plan be counted in millimeters. It was hell. Every open space was a trap, designed so that several defensive positions could fire at the attackers from almost every direction at once. 

And it's not like said defensive positions were easy to take down. Cementoss did his best. It was not a pure concrete - it was reinforced concrete created with some trace additions that only made said concrete tougher and more resistant. Purified and the stronger noumus could bulldoze through them with enough force, and so could the Re-Destro and Geten clones. Nothing else had much luck. 

Several bunkers were carved open, with the attackers trying to pursue the defenders into the labyrinth of the underground corridors dug out with the help of some earth-altering quirks. Fatal mistake. The corridors were a death trap even worse than the surface installations. 

Overhaul was impatient. He knew that he couldn‚Äôt continue this assault forever. Reinforcements were on the way for Nedzu as well, or so he suspected (he was yet to find out about the odd assembly of Paragons and Table members being warped in by Kurogiri to a place a few kilometers behind his command post). Worst of all, he literally couldn‚Äôt lose that battle. 

Losing in Shizuoka right after losing in Nagoya? That would be a mood changer. Force that controlled half of Japan (and not the densely populated one) couldn‚Äôt allow itself to lose two major battles in a row. And by the time the PLF forces broke through the UA Wall, Overhaul lost too many soldiers to be able to pull back and call it a day without having Nedzu and perhaps All Might‚Äôs bloodied corpses to show to the world. 

He still didn‚Äôt show up one the frontline himself. Without that, plan B couldn‚Äôt start. 

 

***

Re-Destro was unimaginably stressed. He saw the MLA warriors - people he knew by name and by quirk, all of them! - were dying left and right. The UA defenses were several orders of magnitude greater than he or Overhaul expected. 

Unfortunately for the defenders of the UA, Re-Destro‚Äôs strength is proportional to how stressed he is. And right now he is very, very stressed. 80% Liberation is a go - he is now a black, hulking juggernaut capable of crushing everything in his wake. He crushes bunkers, annihilates heroes. Nothing can stand against him. 

Rat just tried to corner him with a hero party. Crimson Riot and Fatgum to resist his attacks and draw his attention, with Edgeshot appearing out of nowhere and knocking Re-Destro out with his supermove. Three notable heroes including Edgeshot, Number Four Hero. Re-Destro is flattered. 

Rat didn‚Äôt know that Re-Destro wasn‚Äôt showing up on the frontlines earlier because Overhaul was‚Ä¶ improving him. Crimson Riot is sent flying almost instantly. Fatgum has his fat storage emptied in seconds. Edgeshot moves too slow, and almost dies. The ninja reforms away from him, clutching the broken remnants of his legs. 

Re-Destro lunges towards him. He will end the Number Four Hero right there, before he escapes. He can see the dawning horror in the ninja heroes‚Äô eyes when suddenly something hits him from the side with enough power to throw him back. 

He stands back from the hit. It was strong, but nowhere near strong enough. But his stress? Yes, his stress is growing. 

There is a figure in a hero uniform floating in the air next to Edgeshot. Re-Destro recognizes him immediately.

‚ÄúMy oh my.‚Äù He laughs while now scrawny Fatgum pulls Edgeshot back. Crimson Riot is back there, bleeding profusely but still ready to help carry Number Four Hero to safety. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know that One for All makes people fly, Lemillion.‚Äù 

‚ÄúThere have been‚Ä¶ developments.‚Äù The hero replies scarcely. He doesn‚Äôt even acknowledge the fact that Re-Destro knows about his quirks. Overhaul told them all. ‚ÄúOne for All isn‚Äôt the only power I carry now.‚Äù 

All Might is probably busy tearing through the Purified. Together with Captain Celebrity. That was one terrifying team-up, in Re-Destro opinion. Celebrity with his aerial mobility was pushing them towards All Might. Nedzu was probably telling him where to go exactly to achieve that.

‚ÄúGuess what, Lemillion.‚Äù Re-Destro smiles as his stress level approaches one hundred percent. ‚ÄúI have more than one quirk now as well.‚Äù 

The quirks of his compatriots are in him, now. He powers up Geten‚Äôs quirk and the temperature around him falls down, the ice readying itself for ranged attacks. Curious‚Äô quirk makes his touch make everything explosive (that‚Äôs how he got Edgeshot down), and Trumpet‚Äôs quirk empowers the MLA warriors storming the area during the fight. 

He will take revenge in their stead. He will win for them. 

 

***

The attack gets bogged down after three hours of grinding warfare of attrition. Nedzu‚Äôs ingenious fortification planning and his callousness when it came to ordering half-dead heroes to continue fighting finally succeed in staving off the PLF advance. 

There is only so much that the Trumpet clones can do when it comes to making their fanatic followers continue their attacks over the piles of corpses of their predecessors. They were picked for their charisma and oratory skills, but at this point THEY are the ones who are having enough of it. 

There is also the part when they finally see the school main building. Which also means that Lady Nagant and Gremlin can see them too. Crawler acts as a spotter for them both, the former eliminating officers while the latter opts for Re-Destro and Geten clones. 

The attack slows down and finally halts. Overhaul will have none of it, especially as a special assault party (alongside Sunset) just attacked his Eclipse clone unit that was warping in reinforcements. Lemillion defeating Re-Destro is another unexpected favour, and while the second All Might was too tired and wounded to continue fighting, Overhaul just lost his strongest pawn. 

Celebrity is down for the count, carried behind the frontline looking way worse than he did after that Sky Egg incident. The three colossi of the opposing forces were down to a single one. All Might. If All Might fell‚Ä¶ 

No. 

Overhaul is smarter than this. 

All Might is powerful, but he is growing tired, Overhaul has something like sixty Purified left. He can deal with the Symbol of Peace (he really hoped that he would be in Tokyo, did he fell for Twice‚Äôs clone?) at his leisure. But there is something else he can do right now. 

He grabs some of the warp quirks users he has on standby. He gathers the technopaths. They can‚Äôt exactly take everything down like they did during the Training Camp Battle, but they can make a brief breach. And, besides, they‚Äôve been monitoring the enemy communication long enough to find what he wanted them to. 

Technopaths glitch the UA‚Äôs warp coordinate scramblers momentarily. Overhaul steps out of the warpgate in the middle of Nedzu‚Äôs command post. That infuriating rat is enveloped by his quirk in two seconds. Nedzu and Sir Nighteye (and everyone else in the room) die almost instantly, their bodies disassembled into blood smears on the floor‚Ä¶ 

Blood smear that changes into mud. 

Twice clones. 

Overhaul has a split second to understand that he fell into a trap before Stain, Miruko, Mr. Compress, Eraserhead and Legion (of course he is there) storm the room. Eraserhead switches off Overhaul‚Äôs quirk with his own. Legion stares him down. 

Eraserhead‚Äôs quirk does nothing to Overhaul‚Äôs massively improved body. He is superhumanly fast and strong even without his quirk. There are many quirks (diseases, in his mind) out there and Kai Chisaki knows he needs every asset available to defeat them all. 

His quirk also does nothing to Overhaul‚Äôs quirk. 

Eraserhead never found out that the quirk suppression gas was created on the basis of his quirk. All that Overhaul needed was a blood sample that he stole from a UA-aligned hospital long ago. That and a late-bloomer from the QLF with a quirk allowing them to multiply liquids. All he needed was a single drop of Eri‚Äôs blood this time.

Overhaul had a lot of Eraserhead‚Äôs blood to spare when it came to analyzing quirk. He rendered himself immune to it. But he can‚Äôt say the same about the two Eclipse clones behind him.

Notes:

    We've got to the end! Am I happy about this fic? Honestly, not quite. The ending was rushed, several plotlines I planned (like Shinsou/Split pairing and her help in making him take the chill pill) ended up being somewhat scrapped in the hurry to finish it. I'd also rewrite the story to have a smaller text-to-chat ratio, because I slightly lose control over the chatroom (although don't worry, seeing how popular they ended up being I'd simply add more scenes written in text rather than erasing chatrooms). Many events would also play out differently.

    Then again, that was my first fanfic. I sincerely believe that the remaining ones in the series are much better than this one, at least when writing is involved (please, even if the premise looks quirky, give them a chance, they're really good it's just my dumb ass picking unpopular premises out of some deep-seated masochism or smth).

    Still, it was a fun journey. Thank you for all your comments and kudos :D And once again, check other fics in the series.
